extends Object

Utility class with utilities for arrays.

Method Detail

ensureCapacity

public static <T> T[] ensureCapacity(T[] array,
                                     int capacity)
Ensures that an array has a specified capacity. If the array's size exceeds the specified capacity, then the same array is returned. If the array has less size than the specified capacity, a copy of the input array with the specified capacity is returned. The input array must not be null.

Type Parameters:
T - array type.
Parameters:
array - Input array.
capacity - Required size of array.
Returns:
Returns an array with at least the required capacity.

enforceCapacity

public static <T> T[] enforceCapacity(T[] array,
                                      int capacity)
Enforces that an array has a specified capacity. If the array has exactly the specified capacity, then the same array is returned. If the array has less or more size than the specified capacity, then a copy of the input array with the specified capacity is returned. The input array must not be null.

Type Parameters:
T - array type.
Parameters:
array - Input array.
capacity - Required size of array.
Returns:
Returns an array with exactly the required capacity.

containsNull

public static boolean containsNull(Object[] array)
Checks if an array contains any null.

Parameters:
array - Array checked.
Returns:
Returns true if the array contains any null.

getFirstNull

public static Integer getFirstNull(Object[] array)
Gets the index of the first null element of an array. The array does not need to be sorted.

Parameters:
array - Array checked.
Returns:
Returns the index of the first null element of the array. If the array does not contain any null element, then returns null.

containsNotNull

public static boolean containsNotNull(Object[] array,
                                      int index)
Checks to make sure that the array contains a not null element in a specified index.

Parameters:
array - array checked
index - Index searched.
Returns:
Returns true if the array contains a not null element in the specified position. If the specified index contains a null, or if the array has less elements than the index, then returns false.

                               Object sample)
Checks whether an array contains a given object.

Parameters:
array -
sample -
Returns:
true if the sample is contained in the array.

copyOf

public static <T> T[] copyOf(T[] original,
                             int newLength)
Copies the specified array, truncating or padding with nulls (if necessary) so the copy has the specified length. For all indices that are valid in both the original array and the copy, the two arrays will contain identical values. For any indices that are valid in the copy but not the original, the copy will contain null. Such indices will exist if and only if the specified length is greater than that of the original array. The resulting array is of exactly the same class as the original array.
This method is a copy from the class java.util.Arrays from JDK 1.6.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
original - the array to be copied
newLength - the length of the copy to be returned
Returns:
a copy of the original array, truncated or padded with nulls to obtain the specified length
Throws:
NegativeArraySizeException - if newLength is negative
NullPointerException - if original is null

copyOf

public static byte[] copyOf(byte[] original,
                            int newLength)
Copies the specified array, truncating or padding with nulls (if necessary) so the copy has the specified length.

Parameters:
original - the array to be copied
newLength - the length of the copy to be returned
Returns:
a copy of the original array, truncated or padded with nulls to obtain the specified length

arrayAsListOfArrays

public static List<Object[]> arrayAsListOfArrays(Object[] array)
Transforms an array of objects to a list of object arrays, with each array containing one element of the input array. This method is useful for testing with multiple parmaters.

Parameters:
array - Array.
Returns:
Returns a list of one element arrays.

removeNulls

public static <T> T[] removeNulls(T[] array)
Removes nulls from an array.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of objects in the array.
Parameters:
array - Array from which the nulls are removed.
Returns:
Returns an array with the same elements as the input array, but without nulls. If the initial array contained any null then the new array is packed, eliminating nulls.

removeNulls

public static <T> List<T> removeNulls(List<T> list)
Removes nulls from a list.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of objects in the list.
Parameters:
list - List from which the nulls are removed.
Returns:
Returns a list that does not contain any null.

isNullOrEmpty

public static <T> boolean isNullOrEmpty(T[] array)
Checks if the input array is null or empty.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of array element.
Parameters:
array - Input array.
Returns:
True, if input is null or empty array.

safeGet

public static <T> T safeGet(T[] array,
                            int index)
Gets an element from the given array that corresponds to the given index, taking into account bad input. The result is the equivalent of array[index] if the index is in bounds and the array is not null.

Type Parameters:
T - elements type.
Parameters:
array -
index -
Returns:
array[index], or null for bad input.

equals

                                 T[] array2)
Compares two arrays for equality.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
array1 -
array2 -
Returns:
Returns true if the two arrays have the same elements one by one.
